programme.title: Mom vs. Matchmaker
programme.desc: Everyone takes a shot at finding puppy love for Aaron.

programme.title: The Boy That Never Was
programme.desc: Robins behaviour grows more mysterious when she begins to search a woman called Eva Doyle online.

programme.title: Amber Alert
programme.desc: A rideshare becomes a high-stakes game of cat and mouse when Jaq and Shane receive an Amber Alert on their phones. When they spot the kidnappers car with the girl in the back seat, they desperately race against time to save her before its too late. Starring Hayden Panettiere, Tyler James Williams, Kevin Dunn.

programme.title: Aliens Abducted My Parents and Now I Feel Kinda Left Out
programme.desc: High school journalist Itsy befriends her space-obsessed neighbor Calvin. After he convinces her that his parents were abducted by aliens, together they concoct a plan to get them back. Starring Emma Tremblay, Jacob Buster, Will Forte.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Love Thy Nephew
programme.desc: When a litigious neighbor asks Bernie to tear down the treehouse he built for Jordan, it leads to an all-night standoff.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Road to Tradition
programme.desc: When the children become obsessed with gifts, Bernie decides to cancel Christmas altogether; Wanda loses the Christmas spirit when she tries to get everyone on her staff a gift.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Laughing Matters
programme.desc: Bernie turns to Angela Bassett for acting advice when he lands a dramatic role as a stroke victim; Jordan leads a revolt at a day care facility; Vanessa pretends to be poor.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Hair Jordan
programme.desc: Bernie takes Jordan to his favorite barbershop, but the owner throws them out; Wanda and the girls try to change the batteries in a smoke detector.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Love Bug
programme.desc: Bernie tries to scare away Vanessas new boyfriend but realizes what a good role model he is for Jordan; Wanda has trouble letting go of her old shoes.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show - Its a Wonderful Wife
programme.desc: Wanda disrupts Bernies writing process as he prepares for an appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show.

programme.title: The Forgettable Life of Liam White
programme.desc: An uninspired novelist begins a journey of self-reflection and reconciliation when he learns that his cancer has returned.

programme.desc: Meet the new Shark PowerDetect Upright Vacuum with features like DuoClean Detect Technology, self-cleaning brush roll and odor neutralizing and you will be cleaning faster, smarter and better!

programme.desc: Charles Stanley, pastor of the First Baptist Church in Atlanta, shares his insights on Christian faith and enlightens viewers with spiritual motivation.

programme.title: The Dempsey Sisters
programme.desc: Three siblings (Cymphonique Miller, Denyce Lawton, Teairra Mari) return to their musical roots, agreeing to let their brother manage their family band.

programme.title: Steps of Faith
programme.desc: Mocked by her family for opening a hippotherapy farm for children, Faith questions her message from God after a child is nearly injured and the work is overwhelming.

programme.title: Back to the Goode Life
programme.desc: A successful New York banker goes from being boss to being broke after she is wrongfully accused of unethical banking practices.

programme.desc: A jockey (Tobey Maguire), an automobile magnate (Jeff Bridges) and a trainer (Chris Cooper) lead a racehorse to glory during the Great Depression.

programme.title: The English Patient (1996)
programme.desc: A Hungarian counts (Ralph Fiennes) fling with a British newlywed leads to tragedy in World War II North Africa.

programme.title: Reds (1981)
programme.desc: U.S. journalist John Reed (Warren Beatty) and wife Louise Bryant (Diane Keaton) witness the Russian Revolution.

programme.title: Vanished
programme.desc: Alice uncovers secrets about Tom as allies turn suspect; after a murder and a deadly chase, she fears hes caught in something darker.

programme.title: The Hillside Strangler
programme.desc: As the case falters, the judge turns Buonos prosecution over to the California Attorney General, launching the longest and most expensive trial in U.S. history; decades later, Bianchi maintains his innocence and fights for parole.

programme.title: Audrey Rose (1977)
programme.desc: Parents (Marsha Mason, John Beck) of a girl notice odd behavior after a man (Anthony Hopkins) tells them she holds his dead daughters spirit.

programme.title: Catch-22 (1970)
programme.desc: Air Force officers try to cope with the insanity of World War II in this adaptation of Joseph Hellers novel.

programme.title: Yours, Mine and Ours (1968)
programme.desc: A widow (Lucille Ball) with eight children meets, courts and weds a widowed Navy officer (Henry Fonda) with a brood of 10.

programme.title: The Great Escape (1963)
programme.desc: A group of Allied soldiers are intent on breaking out, not only to escape, but also to draw Nazi forces away from battle to search for fugitives. Among the prisoners are American Captain Virgil Hilts and British Squadron Leader Roger Bartlett.

programme.title: The Russia House (1990)
programme.desc: A London publisher turned spy (Sean Connery) falls in love with his Moscow contact (Michelle Pfeiffer).

programme.title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.sub-title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.desc: Hoping to leave his dark past behind him, former assassin Finbar Murphy leads a quiet life in a coastal Irish town. However, when terrorists show up, he must soon choose between exposing his secret identity and defending his friends and neighbors.

programme.title: Vanished
programme.desc: Alice uncovers secrets about Tom as allies turn suspect; after a murder and a deadly chase, she fears hes caught in something darker.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning (2023)
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team must track down a terrifying new weapon that threatens all of humanity if it falls into the wrong hands. With control of the future and the fate of the world at stake, a deadly race around the globe begins.

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
programme.desc: Jack Ryan (Ben Affleck) and the CIA director (Morgan Freeman) try to stop terrorists who are planning a nuclear attack.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October (1990)
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: American Assassin (2017)
programme.desc: Cold War veteran Stan Hurley takes CIA black ops recruit Mitch Rapp under his wing, and they join forces with a lethal Turkish agent to stop a mysterious operative who wants to start a global war.

programme.title: Shaft (2000)
programme.desc: A detective (Samuel L. Jackson) and a narcotics cop (Vanessa L. Williams) track a sociopath out to kill a woman who can testify that he committed murder.

programme.title: The Yards (2000)
programme.desc: A friends lure of easy money draws an ex-con into the corrupt world of his uncles subway-train business.

programme.title: Serpico (1973)
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: I See You (2019)
programme.desc: Strange occurrences plague a small-town detective and his family as he investigates the disappearance of a boy.

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
programme.desc: Jack Ryan (Ben Affleck) and the CIA director (Morgan Freeman) try to stop terrorists who are planning a nuclear attack.

programme.title: Kindred (2025)
programme.desc: A pair of twisted, young criminals decide to break into a mansion for one big score, but they soon find out that the owners of the house are much more dangerous than they are.

programme.title: Wander (2020)
programme.desc: Hired to investigate a suspicious death in the town of Wander, a paranoid private eye with a troubled past becomes convinced the case is linked to the same conspiracy and cover-up that caused the death of his daughter.

programme.title: Switchback (1997)
programme.desc: A college student (Jared Leto) and a former rail worker (Danny Glover) are suspects in an FBI agents (Dennis Quaid) hunt for a serial killer who abducted his son.

programme.title: The Cut (2024)
programme.desc: Given one last shot at glory, a former boxing champion has just six days to make weight for a title fight. His obsession soon leaves him at the mercy of a notorious trainer who takes every last ounce from his mind, body and soul.

programme.title: The Contractor (2022)
programme.desc: When his new assignment goes awry, an elite soldier finds himself hunted and on the run, caught in a dangerous conspiracy and fighting to stay alive long enough to get home and uncover the true motives of those who betrayed him.

programme.title: Witness (1985)
programme.desc: An eight-year-old Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder in a Philadelphia train station. The Philadelphia police captain discovers that the murderers are cops trying to squelch a corruption investigation.

programme.title: The Godfather (1972)
programme.desc: Crime boss Vito Corleone and his sons, the ruthless yet loyal members of the Corleone family, rule their secretive New York empire with an iron fist.

programme.title: The Godfather, Part II (1974)
programme.desc: Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) rules his fathers criminal empire, while flashbacks recall young Vitos (Robert De Niro) climb to power.

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death Of Michael Corleone (1990)
programme.sub-title: The Godfather Coda: The Death Of Michael Corleone (1990)
programme.desc: Dignified Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) joins his wild nephew in a Sicilian vendetta involving the Vatican.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
programme.desc: An aging lawman (Tommy Lee Jones) reflects on his past and laments a changing world while trying to find and protect a hunter who took the cash from a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: Wildcat (2021)
programme.desc: A captive reporter must figure out a way to escape from the militants who ambushed her convoy in the Middle East.

programme.title: Drop Zone (1994)
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (Wesley Snipes) turns skydiver to nab a hijacker (Gary Busey) and his parachutist gang planning to invade the DEA.

programme.title: The Haunting (1999)
programme.desc: A parapsychologist and three others stay in a house reputed to be the site of many awful tragedies and paranormal events.

programme.title: Dont Knock Twice (2016)
programme.desc: A mother looking to reconnect with her estranged daughter attracts the attention of a demonic witch.

programme.title: The Running Man (1987)
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV hosts (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)
programme.desc: Indy (Harrison Ford) and a young adventurer (Shia La Beouf) must ferret out a powerful artifact and keep it out of the hands of a deadly Soviet agent (Cate Blanchett).

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: Archaeologist Jones (Harrison Ford) rescues his kidnapped father (Sean Connery), and the two race the Nazis to find the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone (2007)
programme.desc: Two private investigators (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) tread dangerous ground as they scour the Boston underworld for a kidnapped child.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls (1997)
programme.desc: After escaping from a serial killer, a doctor (Ashley Judd) helps police and a forensic psychologist (Morgan Freeman) track the madman.

programme.title: Face/Off (1997)
programme.desc: An FBI agent (John Travolta) and his nemesis (Nicolas Cage) trade physical identities.

programme.title: Fight or Flight (2024)
programme.desc: A mercenary takes on the job of tracking a high-value asset known only as "The Ghost" on an international flight. Realizing the plane is filled with assassins assigned to kill them both, the pair must work together in a fight for their lives.

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie (2002)
programme.desc: Nitwits (Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Chris Pontius) perform outrageous stunts and pull practical jokes on an unsuspecting public.

programme.title: Jackass: Number Two (2006)
programme.desc: Daredevils go for the gross-out when they subject an unsuspecting public to more outrageous stunts and practical jokes.

programme.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
programme.desc: A woman (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) discovers the horrifying truth about the outside world while living in an underground shelter with two men (John Goodman, John Gallagher Jr.).

programme.title: Disgraced (2017)
programme.desc: An examination of the events surrounding the 2003 murder of Baylor University mens basketball star Patrick Dennehy.

programme.title: The Score (2001)
programme.desc: A master thief (Robert De Niro) agrees to work with a volatile partner (Edward Norton) for one last heist before he retires.

programme.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
programme.desc: A lieutenant colonel and approximately 400 U.S. troops battle 2,000 North Vietnamese soldiers in 1965.

programme.title: Event Horizon (1997)
programme.desc: A spaceship missing for seven years finally re-emerges and sends out a distress signal. But when a team is sent out to investigate, they discover that something sinister has taken over the craft.

programme.title: The Yards (2000)
programme.desc: A friends lure of easy money draws an ex-con into the corrupt world of his uncles subway-train business.

programme.title: The Beldham (2024)
programme.desc: A struggling new mother fights a generations-old presence lurking within her familys home, threatening her safety, her sanity, and the life of her infant child.

programme.title: Heatwave (2022)
programme.desc: A womans life takes an unexpected turn when she falls for her bosss wife. She must soon defend herself as she becomes entangled in a web of malice.

programme.title: Shell (2024)
programme.desc: Desperate to reclaim her career, once-beloved actress Samantha Lake gets drawn into the glamorous world of wellness mogul Zoe Shannon, only to uncover a monstrous truth beneath the seemingly flawless surface.

programme.title: Sound of Violence (2021)
programme.desc: A young killer experiences intense pleasure whenever she hears the sound of human pain.

programme.title: The Reader (2008)
programme.desc: In postwar Germany, a teenager (David Kross) has a love affair with an older woman (Kate Winslet) who is hiding a terrible secret.

programme.title: Ask the Dust (2006)
programme.desc: In Depression-era Los Angeles, a fiery Mexican waitress (Salma Hayek) who wants to improve her lot through marriage meets an aspiring writer (Colin Farrell) of Italian descent.

programme.title: The Argument (2020)
programme.desc: When a couple argue about a party and neither will back down, they decide to re-create the evening to determine who is right.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Diary (2001)
programme.desc: An outrageous British woman (Renee Zellweger) decides to take control of her life, but instead falls for two very different men (Colin Firth, Hugh Grant).

programme.title: Roman Holiday (1953)
programme.desc: A young princess (Audrey Hepburn), tired of her constraints, runs off with a U.S. newsman (Gregory Peck) in Rome.

programme.title: Runaway Bride (1999)
programme.desc: A New York reporter (Richard Gere) travels to Maryland to profile a woman (Julia Roberts) who left three bridegrooms at the altar.

programme.title: Down to You (2000)
programme.desc: Two collegians (Freddie Prinze Jr., Julia Stiles) fall in love but have a bumpy affair due to mischievous roommates and the temptation to stray.

programme.title: Save the Last Dance (2001)
programme.desc: A white teenager (Julia Stiles) moves to Chicago after her mothers death and falls for a black student (Sean Patrick Thomas) who shares her love of dance.

programme.title: Kate and Leopold (2001)
programme.desc: A Manhattan woman (Meg Ryan) falls in love with the 19th-century Duke of Albany (Hugh Jackman) who has stepped through a time portal.

programme.title: Election (1999)
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives (2004)
programme.desc: A man and his wife move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides (1999)
programme.desc: Men reminisce about intriguing sisters, whose parents (James Woods, Kathleen Turner) quarantined them after one of the five killed herself.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Mexican painter Frida Kahlo (Salma Hayek) marries fellow artist Diego Rivera who shares her radical political views.

programme.title: Like Water for Chocolate (1992)
programme.desc: The youngest daughter (Lumi Cavazos) of a Mexican family expresses her feelings in preparing wonderful food, when tradition keeps her from marrying her true love (Marco Leonardi).

programme.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: Jersey Girl (2004)
programme.desc: A young woman (Liv Tyler) changes the life of a single father (Ben Affleck) who used to be a successful New York music publicist.

programme.title: Losing Isaiah (1995)
programme.desc: An ex-crack addict (Halle Berry) fights for custody of her son adopted by a social worker (Jessica Lange) and her husband (David Strathairn).

programme.title: End of Sentence (2019)
programme.desc: After being released from prison, a young man reluctantly embarks on a journey with his estranged father to spread his mothers ashes in her native Ireland.

programme.title: Blue Eyed Girl (2025)
programme.desc: Summoned home to visit her two sisters and her ailing father, a woman starts to re-evaluate her life as she wonders what could have been.

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen (2016)
programme.desc: A high school junior (Hailee Steinfeld) develops an unexpected bond with a thoughtful teen (Hayden Szeto) after learning that her best friend (Haley Lu Richardson) is dating her older brother (Blake Jenner).

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: Pixie sets out to avenge her mothers death and attempts a heist that will give her the means to leave her small-town life behind. When the plan goes horribly wrong, shes forced to team up with a pair of misfits who are clearly in over their heads.

programme.title: Shes All That (1999)
programme.desc: A cool teen (Freddie Prinze Jr.) bets a friend that he can transform the schools geekiest girl (Rachael Leigh Cook) into a prom queen.

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.sub-title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.desc: Secretly in love with his friend (Kate Bosworth), a supermarket manager (Topher Grace) becomes jealous when she meets a famous actor (Josh Duhamel).

programme.title: Eagle vs. Shark (2007)
programme.desc: A socially awkward fast-food waitress (Loren Horsley) flips over a video-game clerk (Jemaine Clement), who is busy plotting revenge on a bully from his past.

programme.title: No Strings Attached (2011)
programme.desc: After sex enters the equation, two lifelong friends (Natalie Portman, Ashton Kutcher) make a pact to keep their relationship purely physical.

programme.title: The Romantics (2010)
programme.desc: Longtime rivalries resurface in the hours before a woman is scheduled to marry the former lover of her college roommate.

programme.title: Sabrina (1995)
programme.desc: Sons (Harrison Ford, Greg Kinnear) of a Long Island tycoon become romantic rivals for the chauffeurs daughter (Julia Ormond).

programme.title: Forces of Nature (1999)
programme.desc: A bridegroom (Ben Affleck) hurries by plane to his wedding, but he and his seatmate (Sandra Bullock) must find other modes of travel.

programme.title: Emma (1996)
programme.desc: Things keep getting worse after a young matchmaker (Gwyneth Paltrow) finds a mate for a simple young woman (Toni Collette) in rural 1800s England.

programme.title: Ella Enchanted (2004)
programme.desc: A young woman (Anne Hathaway) embarks on a journey to break the curse of obedience placed upon her by a fairy godmother.

programme.title: Love, Rosie (2014)
programme.desc: Rosie and Alex are best friends until Alexs family moves to America. They gamble everything to keep their love and friendship alive over the years and miles.

programme.title: Jennys Wedding (2015)
programme.desc: When Jenny (Katherine Heigl) decides to marry a woman (Alexis Bledel), her conventional family must accept who she is or risk losing her forever.

programme.title: Would You Rather (2012)
programme.desc: Iris (Brittany Snow) and seven other desperate people become trapped in Shepards (Jeffrey Combs) mansion. Shepard forces them to play a sadistic game for a large sum of money -- but the dilemmas become increasingly deadly.

programme.title: Shell (2024)
programme.desc: Desperate to reclaim her career, once-beloved actress Samantha Lake gets drawn into the glamorous world of wellness mogul Zoe Shannon, only to uncover a monstrous truth beneath the seemingly flawless surface.

programme.title: The Hours (2002)
programme.desc: The writings of Virginia Woolf (Nicole Kidman) affect a housewife (Julianne Moore) and emulate the life of a New Yorker (Meryl Streep) who is in love with a dying poet.

programme.title: Winter Spring Summer or Fall (2024)
programme.desc: Young Remi has her future figured out, until she meets Barnes, who lives for the moment and makes her question everything. As their love story unfolds, she faces a choice -- stick to her plan or risk it all for a life she never saw coming.

programme.title: Hooked on Africa
programme.desc: Featuring deep sea fishing, sea fly fishing and fishing charters in and around Cape Town.

programme.title: Inside Angling
programme.desc: We visit the Orange River, just below Van der Kloof Dam, to target largemouth and smallmouth yellowfish at the comfortable Gkhui Gkhui River Lodge in the Northern Cape.

programme.title: Wild Fly
programme.desc: Experience one of the worlds great natural wonders as hordes of Sharp Tooth Catfish hunt en mass creating a feeding frenzy like you have never encountered before. Add to that the majesty of the Okavango Delta and it simply has to be seen.

programme.title: Wild Fish Wild Places
programme.desc: To celebrate his birthday, Denis stages a one-day marathon at Fort Peck - targeting every species he can find in a non-stop, high-energy fishing bash.

programme.title: Fishing the Wild With Mike Robinson
programme.desc: Joe and Dan are in Peloponnese in Greece to learn about the invasive and venomous lionfish. Diving with a pole spear to eradicate as many as possible and cooking with the locals.
